meanings.definition: The retention of juvenile characteristics in an adult organism.
meanings.sent1: The paedomorphosis of the salamander allows it to keep its gills into adulthood.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study paedomorphosis in axolotls to understand how they retain their larval features.
meanings.sent3: The paedomorphosis of the puppy made it look forever young and adorable.
meanings.sent4: Her paedomorphosis was like a time machine, keeping her appearance unchanged.
meanings.sent5: The paedomorphosis of the tadpole was so striking that it fascinated the biology students.

meanings.definition: The process by which an organism reaches sexual maturity while retaining juvenile physical characteristics.
meanings.sent1: In paedomorphosis, the newt reaches reproductive age but still looks like a juvenile.
meanings.sent2: The study of paedomorphosis in certain fish species reveals interesting patterns of development.
meanings.sent3: The paedomorphosis of the frog was so extreme that it confused other frogs.
meanings.sent4: Her paedomorphosis was a unique blend of maturity and youthfulness.
meanings.sent5: The paedomorphosis of the bird was a beautiful display of nature's wonders.

meanings.definition: The phenomenon in which an organism exhibits traits typical of a juvenile stage of development.
meanings.sent1: The paedomorphosis of the axolotl is a fascinating example of arrested development.
meanings.sent2: The genetic basis of paedomorphosis in salamanders is still being researched.
meanings.sent3: The paedomorphosis of the kitten made it the favorite of the household.
meanings.sent4: Her paedomorphosis was a reminder of the innocence of childhood.
meanings.sent5: The paedomorphosis of the butterfly was a beautiful sight in the garden.
